content.description:
If given the choice between Netflix binges and getting a sourdough starter going you should choose new routes on limestone every time...... in summer no less.

 A beautiful vertical section of rock with an intermittent layback crack leads to slab and then to a nice overhung section with amazing grips that you'll just want to keep on grippin'.  Go ahead, take another lap.  This fine new addition sports good climbing right off the ground and the fun doesn't stop until you've kneebar clipped, skated on some popcorn feet, and grabbed the double tufas near the last bolt.

 Hot damn this route is fun!
content.location: This is currently the leftmost route at the Slot Machine located on the upper of two cliffs making up the area.  The approach is via a narrow ledge that becomes wider as you near the base of the climbs.  Be very aware when approaching the climbs and belaying from the ledge as it is situated ~30 feet off the ground.  Although the ledge is nice and flat this location is not ideal for dogs, kiddos, or people with vertigo.

content.description:
Lateralus climbs an amazing line of leftward trending pods, slots, and pockets that end just right of the base of the upper pillar that sits atop The Slot Machine.

 The difficulty in this climb comes in the lower half as the angle is slightly overhung and hardest moves reside here.  As the wall eases to vertical and then slab over the final bolts the climbing becomes less strenuous, but will keep your interest as the holds are so unique and the movement is totally enjoyable.  

 This one will be a crowd pleaser.  Hopefully the cliff will produce more climbs as good as this one.
content.protection: 8 bolts to chains w/ lower offs.
content.location: Currently the rightmost climb at the cliff and easily identified as the climb is a left trending diagonal line of bolts.

content.description:
This sector is made up of two separate areas that lie just beyond The Bowling Alley across a large gully

if you are hiking west toward The Vineyard.  Currently there is potential for more fun lines ranging from 60 - 100ft. This little zone is characterized by a multitude of narrow vertical slots and pockets that are found all over the cliff face on slab to slightly overhung wall angles.

 The first area is access via a ledge with the climbs starting ~25 ft. off the ground.  There is plenty of room to belay and be comfortable at the base of these climbs, but it is not an ideal "hang".  It is also not recommended for dogs, kids, or accident prone individuals.  A fall from the ledge would not end well.

 The second area can be accessed by hiking along the cliff base until you see the large hanging pillar with a fixed line currently in place and a nice looking diagonal line, Lateralus (5.11b).

 Development here is still underway as of summer 2020, so please leave fixed lines where they are, and be prepared to help with the cleaning as these routes are still pretty fresh.
